# addCompletion(_:)

**Instance Method**

Adds the specified completion block to the animator.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func addCompletion(_ completion: @escaping (UIViewAnimatingPosition) -> Void)
```

```swift
@MainActor func addCompletion() async -> UIViewAnimatingPosition
```

## Parameters

- **completion**: A block to execute when the animations finish. This block has no return value and takes the following parameter:



## Discussion

Completion blocks are executed after the animations finish normally. If you call the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewAnimating/stopAnimation(_:)] method, the completion blocks are not called if you specify [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] for the method’s parameter. If you specify [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] for the parameter, the animator executes the completion blocks normally after you call the its [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewAnimating/finishAnimation(at:)] method.

You may add completion blocks to an animator at any time, including while it is stopped.

## Modifying animations

- **addAnimations(_:)**: Adds the specified animation block to the animator.
- **addAnimations(_:delayFactor:)**: Adds the specified animation block with a delay.
- **continueAnimation(withTimingParameters:durationFactor:)**: Adjusts the timing and duration of a paused animation.
